page.title: 03NORTH CLIFF OF HORNSEA
page.content: At North Cliff we observed the{North {Cliff Boating Club}on top of the cliff. To get down to the sea, the boats get pulled by tractors down a slipway.A{stream}caused a valley which runs down the cliff. There is also a {caravan park. On the{beach,}we measured from the cliff to the sea at{low water}which is {50m.}We were each given a metre to do. We measured{sand}as{75%, shingle (<1cm) as{11%, pebbles}(1-5cm) as{11%, and{rocks}(>5cm) as{3%. The{cliff}is made mostly of{clay}with chalk buried deep down. The height is {15.39m.}It is a natural coast, uninterfered with by man. As well as the{sea, drains erode the cliff as water trickles out. {Streams}cause valleys and{rain}causes gulleys. Simon Alexander
